reviewDescription: I originally got a four pack of these in 2021 for free. After sharing half of it with my friend and trying it for a year, I bought another 4 pack when I ran out. The newest 4 pack I just bought has an expiry date of 9/2023, so I have about a year and a half to use them up. Each tube is sealed with foil until you’re ready yo use it.I’ve been using sensodyn for over a decade now because my dentist had recommended it. Over the years, I’ve tried many different varieties and flavors. This tooth paste works well in keeping my teeth pain free for the most part, as long as I don’t overdo it with eating a ton of acidic foods. So daily bowl of fruit or occasional glass of white wine no longer cause tooth aches.The one big difference between this and the other sensodyn varieties I’ve tried in the past is the foam texture. It’s not super foaming like some gel toothpastes, and actually almost coagulates into little wisps of more solid texture as you brush, which I thought was weird and took a little time to get used to. However, this cleans pretty well combined with my electric toothbrush and I’ve been very happy with it overall, as evidenced by my repurchase.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022

reviewDescription: Sensodyne toothpaste, OK but quick release is better! I figured stand within the Sensodyne family that they’re all the same but they’re not. The quick release action for very sensitive gum lines is better than this one, this one also has a funky flavor to it.

reviewDescription: Sensodyne Sensitivity & Gum Sensitive Toothpaste for Gingivitis & Treatment, Clean & Fresh, 3.4 Oz, Pack of 4While using this, I did notice that my gums and the teeth where I have some gum recession seemed less sensitive.  I'm not sure if this is a cumulative affect over time, or whether it is some ingredient in the toothpaste that works while brushing only.  It does what it says it does.I've been using Sensodyne toothpastes for a while now.  One thing that I did notice about it is this toothpaste is thicker than other Sensodyne toothpastes.  There is definitely a noticeable difference.  This isn't a complaint and, in fact, makes it a bit easier to use.  Sensodyne toothpastes can normally be a bit thin and can run out of my mouth toward the end of my brushing.  This is a lot less likely to do that.The flavor is not bad.  It's minty, but a little less minty than their other toothpaste types.  It's toothpaste, so it's not like it's going to have an amazing flavor.  It's fine.The one thing that would be great is if Sensodyne would add some whitening ingredients to this.  If they did that, it would be perfect!In terms of cost, I did a quick check of some of the big box stores and Amazon has this priced very reasonably.  Especially with the current $3 off coupon.  Make sure to check that box when buying this.

reviewDescription: I have been using Sensodyne for years because I have sensitive teeth.  This has helped with my sensitive teeth greatly!  I used it in the morning and in the evening every day.  My dentist has said that my teeth and gums look very healthy.  So overall I am very satisfied with Sensodyne. You really can't go wrong with any of the different variations of Sensodyne.  I can't say that I have noticed any drastic difference between the different types of Sensodyne.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 4, 2021

reviewDescription: My wife ordered this Sensodyne toothpaste for me, (her husband), when the dentist recommended it to help deal with tooth and gum discomfort. While it doesn't completely eliminate the discomfort, I have noticed a definite reduction in temperature sensitivity, and occasional pain, since I started using it.Sensodyne has a fresh minty flavor, but it's not overpowering, just leaves my mouth feeling minty fresh. The inclusion of stannous fluoride provides protection from cavities. Sensodyne works well for most sensitivities and is highly recommended by dentists, so I'll definitely keep using it.If you are looking for a toothpaste to help with tooth and gum sensitivity, Sensodyne is the market leader with good reason. It simply works.Highly recommended!
reviewTitle: This Sensodyne toothpaste was recommended for my husband by his dentist!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 5, 2021

reviewDescription: I have been switching between Sensodyne and other toothpaste brands the past couple of years.  I've been specifically dealing with gum and sensitivity issues with my teeth this past spring summer. I've been having a difficult time drinking hot or cold beverages. I've also noticed that my gums don't feel great after flossing. Due to the current climate and being in quarantine I've been trying my best to take good care of my teeth and gums.  I can whiten my teeth a little each day, and my sensitive teeth won't hurt! The taste isn't bad, but it's also not the greatest. It's thick, white toothpaste and leaves my mouth feeling a little dry after. Honestly though, even with this, I still love the product and use it twice a day!
reviewTitle: Comfortable for the most sensitive gums
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 11, 2021

reviewDescription: Sensodyne Sensitivity & Gum Sensitive Toothpaste for Gingivitis, Sensitive Teeth Treatment is very effective.  This toothpaste also contains stannous fluoride which is an anti-bacterial agent that's clinically proven to protect against gingivitis, plaque and tooth sensitivity in addition to providing cavity protection.This toothpaste has a good tasting spearmint flavor which makes it easy to brush longer.  It really does help prevent pain that my sensitive teeth can experiece from various temperatures. I also appreciate having the additional support for gum health.Sensodyne Sensitivity & Gum Sensitive Toothpaste is a really good choice for complete mouth dental health. It works as expected to relieve sensitivity issues.
reviewTitle: Good tasting spearmint flavor and effective ingredients for sensitive teeth

reviewDescription: For anyone with sensitive teeth, Sensodyne is the brand to go to. The range of Sensodyne toothpaste names can be overwhelming, but the key ingredient to be aware of is stannous fluoride. Most fluoride toothpaste use sodium fluoride, which is great for preventing cavities, but stannous fluoride has the added benefits of helping to desensitize teeth and also some antibacterial effects.This new Sensitivity and Gum Sensitive toothpaste includes stannous fluoride. Otherwise, it's not clear how it is different from other Sensodyne toothpastes that have stannous fluoride. It has a nice minty flavor, not too overwhelming. Overall works great.
reviewTitle: Sensodyne is the best toothpaste for sensitive teeth

Sodium fluoride is more commonly found in toothpastes but stannous fluoride be better for fighting bacteria and protecting gums.

reviewDescription: This toothpaste tastes great and leaves your mouth feeling fresh for a long time. I prefer the taste over any Crest or Colgate flavor. I have a little bit of gum sensitivity due to receding gums, and I did feel relief from sensitivity (thanks to the ingredient of stannous fluoride) while using this toothpaste. Stannous fluoride has antimicrobial properties and prevents plaque bacteria buildup. This ingredient is unique to this particular toothpaste, as most other toothpastes contain sodium fluoride. My only complaint is that it is much more expensive than regular toothpaste. However, if my teeth become more sensitive, I may just switch to this toothpaste.

reviewDescription: I don’t have active gingivitis but I do have some areas of sensitive teeth, and Sensodyne does seem to help a little with this.  I asked my dentist about it and he was equivocal; I’m not sure if he didn’t want to endorse a specific brand or didn’t want to commit to whether it works for anything other than cleaning my teeth, but at least I am very happy with the way it cleans my teeth.  It leaves them feeling smooth and my breath feeling fresh.  I also like the design of the tube, that the large cap allows it to stand up by itself.  Maybe it will help protect my gingiva, too—we’ll see.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021

reviewDescription: There's not much to say about this product...I ordered this when I saw it pop up as available, and since I have been using Sensodyne ProNamel toothpaste for many years, I thought I would give it a shot.It has a stronger mint flavor than the ProNamel toothpaste we have been using before (I think the ProNamel flaver is "Mint Essence", and I find that to be a good thing.  It just feels more "fresh" after brushing.  There is an unusual sensation when brushing with this toothpaste - I would almost describe it as a warming sensation.  Maybe this is the sensitivity aspect?  I'm really not sure.  It isn't unpleasant at all - just different than what I used before.Easy recommendation from me.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021

reviewDescription: If you're like me, you have very sensitive teeth and have had it most of your life.  You've had problems eating ice cream and even strongly acidic, sugary candy.Those problems have all but gone away completely after using Sensodyne toothpaste for several weeks.  It really works and works well.  But you have to be consistent and use it for at least a two weeks.  I don't know the long term impact of using this medicated toothpaste, so I don't use it every time.  I switch back to my regular toothpaste whenever I don't have the symptoms.. They come back, but it takes a few weeks.. So I think if you just use this product once a week for maintenance, each tube will go a long way compared to switching to it as your primary toothpaste.
reviewTitle: I'm a big fan of sensodyne now.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2021

reviewDescription: This Sensodyne Sensitivity & Gum Sensitive Toothpaste for Gingivitis has a mild mint flavor and works well for sensitive teeth and gums. The photo showing four tubes has "whitening" on three of them. That is not the product that I received nor what I wanted. The bottom tube says "clean and fresh" and is what I'm reviewing. It is not a whitening product from anything that I see. That's good, because sensitive teeth don't need whiteners irritating them.We've been told to use toothpaste that is less abrasive. I can't find a rating for this one, but I'm hoping it's better than other products from this brand. This does contain hydrated silica, which is abrasive. The question is how big the particles are. I can't find data on this particular product. It also contains sodium lauryl sulfate, known to be an irritant for many. I'd love to know the relative dentin abrasivity for this toothpaste. Still, this is better than most options, and I find it to be gentle on my teeth and gums. Highly recommend!
reviewTitle: Gentle on teeth and gums, dual action (not whitening)

reviewDescription: My mouth has been a disaster area for much of my life. Primary responsibility goes to the family dentist who never said a word about gum health.More recently, a periodontist recommended this Sensodyne paste to me, and I must say, after a few weeks' use, I seem to be feeling fewer aches and pains in my gums and teeth.I can't say I'm crazy about the flavor, which I find a bit odd. It's almost as if the manufacturer wanted to make the taste a little off-putting so you remember you're using a "medicinal" toothpaste.Unfortunately, though, after a few months of use, the hygienist was complaining again about my poor oral hygiene, noting in particular the stains on my teeth.So -- I discontinued use of this toothpaste and have been trying the Crest Gum Restore toothpaste with stannous flouride and whitening. At least that seems to be keeping the tooth stains to a minimum; we'll see what the hygienist says about the oral hygiene...
